definition: to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately
to make an appointment/to invite/approximately/pact/treaty/to economize/to restrict/to reduce (a fraction)/concise
to weigh in a balance or on a scale

sentences.english: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?
sentences.chinese: 岂肯与你立约，使你拿它永远作奴仆吗。

sentences.english: And all the men of Jabesh said to him, "Make a treaty with us, and we will be subject to you."
sentences.chinese: 雅比众人对拿辖说，你与我们立约，我们就服事你。

sentences.english: They entered into a covenant to seek the Lord , the God of their fathers, with all their heart and soul.
sentences.chinese: 他们就立约，要尽心尽性地寻求耶和华他们列祖的神。

sentences.english: For this is my blood of the new testament, which is shed for many for the remission of sins.
sentences.chinese: 因为这是我立约的血，为多人流出来，使罪得赦。

sentences.english: I do set my bow in the cloud， and it shall be for a token of a covenant between me and the earth.
sentences.chinese: 我把虹放在云彩中，这就可作我与地立约的记号了。

sentences.english: There were peaceful relations between Hiram and Solomon, and the two of them made a treaty.
sentences.chinese: 希兰与所罗门和好，彼此立约。

sentences.english: The two of them made a covenant before the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 于是二人在耶和华面前立约。

sentences.english: I have set my rainbow in the clouds, and it will be the sign of the covenant between me and the earth.
sentences.chinese: 我把虹放在云彩中，这就可作我与地立约的记号了。

sentences.english: Do not make a covenant with them or with their gods.
sentences.chinese: 不可和他们并他们的神立约。

sentences.english: He had gone get the two tables of stone on which God wrote the Ten Commandments.
sentences.chinese: 他去了西乃山并拿到了与神立约二块法版。

sentences.english: The LORD our God made a covenant with us at Horeb.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华我们的神在何烈山与我们立约。

sentences.english: The conspirators were bound to secrecy.
sentences.chinese: 这些谋反者立约保守秘密。

sentences.english: Facts: The coal company deeded the surface land above a mine to Mahon's predecessors in title.
sentences.chinese: 煤矿公司立约转让煤矿表面的土地给马宏的前辈。

sentences.english: The name of Jehovah was so covenantal.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华的名显示祂是立约的神。

sentences.english: We contracted with a local clothing firm for 400 shirts a month.
sentences.chinese: 我们与当地一家服装公司立约每月订购400件衬衫。

sentences.english: The Bank shall cancel the Applicant's Customer ID immediately upon receiving the notice.
sentences.chinese: 贵行收到通知后应即注销立约人之用户代码。

definition: Jehovah (biblical name for God, Hebrew: YHWH)/compare Yahweh 雅威[Ya3 wei1] and God 上帝[Shang4 di4]
tabernacle (biblical word for a meeting hall or tent)
Abraham (name)/Abraham, father of Judaism and Islam in the Bible and Quran/same as Ibrahim 易卜拉辛
to break an agreement/to go back on one's word/to fail to keep one's promise
